image.altText: Former Port Adelaide footballer Warren Tredrea at Alberton Oval.

props.synopsis: The Jewish Council of Australia has condemned a social media post by AFL football legend Warren Tredrea, saying it promotes "far-right antisemitic conspiracy theories" and Holocaust denial.

title.children: Jewish Council of Australia 'deeply disturbed' by Warren Tredrea social media post

image.altText: Water in a building.

props.synopsis:
A court has been told a man experiencing drug-induced psychosis broke into a medical research facility and set off fire hydrants. 

Tens of thousands of litres flooded the property, causing nearly $8 million in damages.

title.children: Medical centre trespasser caused 'over $7 million in damages'

image.altText: A view from near the blast furnace of the Whyalla steelworks.

props.synopsis: At least 33 companies — a majority of them from overseas — are interested in acquiring the Whyalla steelworks, according to SA Premier Peter Malinauskas.

title.children: 'At least 33' potential buyers for the Whyalla steelworks, SA Premier says

image.altText: Two female children choose from a tin of coloured textas

props.synopsis: Half of South Australia's childcare centres were not meeting national quality standards before a funding increase led to more inspections and more than double the number of compliance officers, a parliamentary committee has heard.

title.children: SA childcare centre crackdown finds 'half not meeting standards'

image.altText: A smiling man with grey hair holds up a plastic box from the cabin of a truck.

props.synopsis: All of SA's agricultural areas are in severe drought but communities dependent on sheep have been hit particularly hard.

title.children: City Lions clubs raise $100k to buy sheep feed for SA farmers

image.altText: A sign for the Youth Court in Adelaide

props.synopsis: A program allowing young drug-dependent South Australians to be detained against their will for treatment should be scrapped, a government review has been told.

title.children: Calls to ditch 'expensive experiment' on drug-dependent children amid government review

image.altText: A sign outside the Flinders Medical Centre.

props.synopsis: SA Police has denied a Flinders Medical Centre patient tried to grab an officer's gun in an incident the state's doctors' union says left medical staff "clearly shaken and worried".

title.children: Police deny patient reached for officer's gun at SA hospital

image.altText: Rows of houses and a lighthouse line a foreshore at sunset.

props.synopsis: Residents without sewerage connections in the South Australian town of Kingston South East worry about the cost of dealing with waste that has the potential to contaminate bore water used in homes and gardens.

title.children: Sewerage project prioritised after health concerns

image.altText: Police tape along the footpath near a suburban road.

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old man who was stabbed in Adelaide's inner-northern suburbs on Monday had multiple wounds and was running down the street yelling for help, witnesses say. He remains in hospital.

title.children: Trail of blood left after man stabbed in Adelaide's inner-north

image.altText: A gantry and a huge drill in a country area.

props.synopsis: The SA government hopes to exploit gas reserves but activists are disappointed and concerned about what that might mean for a regional fracking ban.

title.children: SA looks to regions for gas supply as market shortfall looms

image.altText: A dry lake with an out-of-focus shrub in the foreground

props.synopsis: Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre is filling for the first time since access to the lake was restricted by a new management plan. An outback boating club has questioned authorities' capacity to enforce the new rules, but traditional owners say the measures respect the environmental and cultural significance of the site.

title.children: Visitors still walking on Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre months after foot traffic ban

image.altText: A man in a black hat standing next to the boot of a car with two blue drums of vegetable oil in it.

props.synopsis: At 95, Ian McLeod's power bills are virtually non-existent while his farm ute costs only a few dollars a week to run. How does he do it?

title.children: 'Thought I was mad': 95yo farmer runs his ute, home on this oil

image.altText: Susan Ley at lectern with hands together pointing forward

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley will tell the National Press Club today the federal opposition needs to better reflect "modern Australia'" and lament the Liberals "got smashed" at the election. Follow live.

title.children: 'We got smashed': Ley's blunt assessment of election result

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Albanese brushes off reports of China trip
Chalmers to lobby US counterpart on tariffs in talks today
'More regular ways' to depart Israel could open up soon: Keogh

image.altText: A red sold sticker across a for sale sign outside a house with a large front yard on a sunny day

props.synopsis: More borrowers are falling behind on mortgage repayments, but experts say numbers are overall low and expected to fall further, with rate cuts expected.

title.children: Strain of interest rates hitting home loan borrowers but relief in sight

image.altText: Julie Inman Grant 4 analysis

props.synopsis: With so many questions about how this ban will work it might be time for the government to clear a runway for a temporary landing.

title.children: Unwieldy social media ban poses a prickly problem for Labor

image.altText: Virgin Australia signs on a window, with ASX boards behind

props.synopsis: Virgin has undergone some radical surgery in the five years since it collapsed, and soared on its ASX re-entry, but the risks of investing in airlines remain.

title.children: Virgin boss dodges a disaster to bring the airline home

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin stands against a grey backdrop in a police mug shot.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Director of Public Prosecutions is appealing against the 14-year prison sentence Xiaozheng Lin received after pleading guilty to the manslaughter of two women in their homes in a 24-hour period in Melbourne in 2022.

title.children: Killer's sentence sends 'chilling message', sex worker advocate says

image.altText: A woman with black hair and an older man with no hair, wearing formal attire on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The wedding party of the billionaire Amazon founder and his journalist fiancee Lauren Sanchez has been moved after weeks of protests against plans to transform Venice into a "private amusement park".

title.children: Jeff Bezos forced to move wedding after protests in Venice

image.altText: A close up of a man's hands placed together in front of his body in a worried pose.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says the National Mental Health and Suicide Prevention Agreement must be re-designed as it's failing to make any real change.

title.children: Australia's 'fundamentally flawed' mental health plan needs to be thrown out: report

image.altText: A woman in black formal wear speaks to the media and supporters outside a court.

props.synopsis: The Federal Court found the ABC contravened the Fair Work Act by terminating journalist Antoinette Lattouf's employment, for reasons "including that she held a political opinion opposing the Israeli military campaign in Gaza".

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf wins unlawful termination case against ABC

image.altText: Childcare

props.synopsis: It seems without deeper reform the childcare system will continue to bleed public money while failing the children it's meant to serve.

title.children: Damning report reveals childcare subsidy has leaked $2.6b

image.altText: Cars on snowy ground

props.synopsis: The snowy Wednesday will follow the passage of powerful cold fronts, which are also delivering much needed rain, along with small hail and thunderstorms.

title.children: South-eastern Australia set for an icy soaking, with snowfall forecast

image.altText: Oil rig in California

props.synopsis: The ASX is fairly flat in early trade despite US stocks jumping overnight as the shaky Israel-Iran ceasefire appeared to hold. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX misses out on share surge as oil plunges on Israel-Iran ceasefire

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX edges higher as commodity producers weigh on the market
ASIC considering its regulatory response to HESTA prolonged outage

image.altText: A full street with people marching with flags and signs, one says: liberation freedom restitution.

props.synopsis: National leaders, experts and community voices on First Nations justice will meet in Alice Springs from today, as pressure grows on the federal government to play a greater role in youth justice.

title.children: First Nations leaders meet in Alice Springs to address incarceration crisis

image.altText: A red ant-like wasp with thin wings, curly antennae all against a salty yellowed white crystal background.

props.synopsis: An eyeless wasp is just one of several new cave-dwelling invertebrates discovered within the proposed boundary of a massive renewable energy project.

title.children: Hand-sized spiders and world-first eyeless wasp discovered under Nullarbor

image.altText: A short man with dark hair speaks animatedly to a tall man with grey hair, in an outdoor setting in front of green, lush trees.

props.synopsis: A two-day NATO summit at The Hague is intended to signal to Russian President Vladimir Putin that the alliance remains united, despite US President Donald Trump's repeated criticisms and threats to pull out if defence spending targets aren't met.

title.children: Trump to meet Zelenskyy at NATO summit as Russia-Ukraine war rages on

image.altText: West Indies players celebrate

props.synopsis: As Australia heads to the West Indies for a three-Test tour and five T20Is, it needs to answer lingering questions over its top order, and reassert its dominance in the first series of the new World Test Championship cycle.

title.children: Australia looking to reassert Test dominance on tour of West Indies

image.altText: Two men deliver budget speech

props.synopsis: In uncertain times, hope is the takeaway in the budget handed down on Tuesday by Queensland's newly minted Treasurer David Janetzki, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: Hope springs eternal in Queensland's ambitious budget

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone in their hand with the screen open to a digital licence with driver's photograph.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity specialists warn a "very cheap coding trick" is being spruiked as a high-tech anti-fraud measure on digital drivers licences.

title.children: Digital drivers licence anti-fraud technology only a 'cheap coding trick'

image.altText: A young girl crying with her family behind her.

props.synopsis: More violence has erupted at an aid distribution centre in the Palestinian enclave as fighting between Israel and Hamas has continued.

title.children: At least 40 Palestinians killed in single day as Gaza fighting continues

image.altText: Photos of three authors and their books pictured against a brown paper background

props.synopsis: ABC experts unpack the shortlist of Australia's biggest book prize: who made it, who missed out and who they think will win.

title.children: Tim Winton misses out on the chance to win his fifth Miles Franklin award

image.altText: Drones depicting the Australian and Aboriginal flags in the night sky above a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: Australia's only national survey tracking reconciliation has released new data showing an almost 40 per cent increase in racism during the past decade.

title.children: Most young people think Australia is a racist country, survey finds

image.altText: A man and woman stand grouped in a selfie with their two young children, one girl and one boy, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Celebrities like Miley Cyrus are speaking about the benefits of eye movement desensitisation and reprocessing (EMDR) therapy. But what is EMDR and its role in psychological treatment?

title.children: When Samuel's mum died, he didn't expect EMDR to be his 'circuit breaker'

image.altText: Two men deliver budget speech

props.synopsis: In uncertain times, hope is the takeaway in the budget handed down on Tuesday by Queensland's newly minted Treasurer David Janetzki, writes Matt Eaton.

title.children: Hope springs eternal in Queensland's ambitious budget

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: The judge in the Erin Patterson triple-murder trial has told the jury that if they believe the evidence given by the accused at trial, they must find her not guilty.

title.children: Jurors must find Erin Patterson not guilty if they believe her, judge says
